name: debased
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
worse than before, especially morally; less valuable or deserving less respect than before: He believes that acts of torture reveal how debased we are. Our world view has become debased. We no longer have a sense of the sacred.
More examplesFewer examplesSuch talk exemplifies how debased modern political discourse has become.Unfortunately, in these debased times, such crimes are not unusual.Here we see politics at its most debased.Even by his low standards this was pretty debased.
